column1: Nice overview of my colleague @ewarren.  https://t.co/U7PmRnmVab

Debate analysis on big issues:   Climate change - Did okay with 2 moderator questions and 36 mentions.   Dark money - Never came up even as 10th anniversary of Citizens United comes. Pathetic.   Court Capture - Never once came up; zero terms related to the judiciary
You gotta see this. Less than three minutes long. Wow. https://t.co/1XIuL7zY3h
We saw what the smear machine did to Hillary. We’re on notice. Yet we’ve done essentially zero to inoculate against it. It will attack again in 2020. When will we learn?   https://t.co/3Fnn3hV54J
Polluters spending unlimited secret money to control government is one of the biggest reasons Congress doesn’t #ActOnClimate.    Learn more here: https://t.co/MPBZ4bKsYH
@JoeBiden Glad moderator @TimAlberta has raised climate change so early on. But any discussion of climate change needs to include dark money.

One reason I like @JoeBiden’s tax plan? It includes provisions to ensure that the wealthiest Americans pay their fair share. I agree. We shouldn’t be giving tax breaks to multi-million-dollar earners.  My ‘Buffett Rule’ bill addresses that.

As we head into tonight’s debate I look forward to a substantive discussion about big issues like campaign finance climate & tax fairness. It’s been pretty interesting seeing how closely my priorities in the Senate align with different candidates.
Yup. We need this. And more. https://t.co/kkUpyRY92f
Give me a Blue New Deal all day long. The oceans urgently need saving.   @Exxonmobil can’t build us a new ocean. Our common home is God’s gift and most of it is our oceans.   https://t.co/cSVBRJ8D0E
“Independence” and “transparency” of unlimited political spending were the two false promises of Citizens United. Here’s a prime example of how false those assurances were.   https://t.co/Gim2DxByos
Speaks for itself... https://t.co/IoyYAXH29Q

I remember a Republican colleague agreeing with me that dark money was a plague.   His advice? “You Democrats are going to have to raise a lot more of it. Maybe once it’s a tie we can get rid of it.”   Let’s hope this helps us get rid of it.   https://t.co/XvKovMhX8I
My colleague @ewarren is smart honorable kind knowledgeable and honest. Trump is cunning amoral cruel ignorant and crooked. I admire David but this is ridiculous.
Republicans love false equivalency but treating Trump and Warren as similar does a real disservice to factual debate.  https://t.co/aa25WVPsnk

From an electronic ad I received. Believe it or not this is the phrase Republicans used for years to oppose and attack Medicare! Their catchphrase was “socialized medicine” as they fought Democrats’ efforts to pass Medicare. https://t.co/Kc3R3X6L1l
.@facebook: ‘We don’t care if you lie so long as you pay us. And we won’t find out who you really are when you pay us.’ Open gate for foreign election interference.    https://t.co/z8BH5FTMLu
Gotta love this! https://t.co/kwtAhOpVcl
So was climate denial so was Hillary’s involvement in child molestation on and on; when you’re propagandizing it just doesn’t matter. Pathetic that DNC hasn’t done more to address this.
Bossert a sincere professional doesn’t understand it doesn’t matter to Trump or Republican attack-and-smear machine that Biden story was “debunked.” https://t.co/w6a4MSELqg
There’re some high-quality priorities.  We’d rather have Trump than pay a fair share? Thanks a bunch guys. Real patriotic of you. https://t.co/cccxgwbQaq
Hmmm. I wonder what Maine Kentucky Ohio and Utah might have in common that could help break the Republican climate blockade in the Senate?? https://t.co/4T5DZQqoh7

Steady as she goes: hard work a bazillion “selfies” well-thought policy plenty of guts; no cheap stunts attacks or please-can-this-go-viral whiffs. Ya gotta love that it’s working. https://t.co/YXYprPbugf

“Any candidate willing to spend four hours taking selfies that’s special for a lot of people.”   Flight canceled Obama drove 4 hours to RI for event. People waited. And it was special to them that he made the effort.  https://t.co/5ncPgDa74U
The candidates called out the NRA for its influence over Republican politicians. But its vast network of influence runs deeper. Follow the money. https://t.co/4Q2xnYRp0q

Dark money infiltrates and pollutes our politics and even our courts. It’s an avenue for both corruption and foreign influence; integrity of democracy is at stake. Number of mentions of dark money in the last debate: Zero. https://t.co/Trsqkdubiw

Big special interests are using the Republican Party to acquire and remake America’s court system in their favor. Everybody has a huge stake in this. Number of mentions of court capture in the last debate: Zero. https://t.co/XBzA0sNNg2
Great article demonstrating why @ewarren is such a great Senate colleague. She’s got grit and purpose.   https://t.co/GHKujtGPCV

Conservative columnist on @ewarren: “her life story ground[s] her in a reality with which most voters can identify… her agenda is not scattershot… she seems to channel the ghost of Franklin D. Roosevelt the friend of the little guy who is going to save capitalism from itself.” https://t.co/ILNDZtMEXL
Root out dark money from Koch denial operation. Demand political effort from corporate America.   WIN FIRST!
“My plan’s bigger than yours.” “No my plan’s bigger than yours!”   Excuse me but how about talking about how to win!?   Call out obstructors like @USChamber. Make supporting them unacceptable.

I hope the climate debate is not about who has the most-bazillion-dollar won’t-pass-Congress plan but how we break the back of the denial/obstruction apparatus. Let’s remember we have to win this battle first.  https://t.co/hXa8iL1CxD
But remember the scrappy class of ‘06 unknowns who won versus the inevitable ‘16ers Bayh Feingold and Strickland who all lost. Scrappiness matters.
No s**t.  https://t.co/ZY6CvWVCmm
Eight years later Workman still remembers how Biden looked at him.   “He has that look where his eyes can see into your eyes” Workman said. “I felt like he really understood.”
Workman’s version is the same but with one added detail. He recalled Biden meeting his gaze. Workman told the vice president that he didn’t want the medal.   “I know you don’t” Biden replied softly.
“Here’s how Biden remembered it: “You see the look on his face — he says ‘Sir I don’t want it. I don’t want it. He died. He died.’ ”
Isn’t this what matters? https://t.co/j3dyCGlHcW

I hope candidates will use @CNN’s climate town hall to lay out plans to stop the dark money blocking climate action. Any candidate who doesn’t have a plan to act on dark money doesn’t have a real plan to act on climate. https://t.co/oGw0PkrxhU
Brave bid @JayInslee. Keep at it; there are other ways to fight.    https://t.co/Run16oIPIQ
Painful. https://t.co/LdhBouLlEI

Hard work; no cheap shots; bold policy; sweating the details; relentless loyalty to fair markets; fearlessness — whoever you’re for you’ve gotta love that voters are responding to this. https://t.co/MzvycVZrVU
Debate check 2: spinning into climate catastrophe corrupted by dark money and captured Supreme Court cranking out 5-4 partisan decisions.   Mentions? Climate: 12   Dark money: 0   Supreme Court: 0
Yikes. Not our finest hour. No kudos to moderators. Candidates need to stop making these debates self-injurious for our party. @danbalz nailed it: https://t.co/dliXQSg8Eb

Tragedy of the Commons — Each candidate has the personal incentive to go for their YouTube moment at the expense of our common interest in going after Trump with the result a debate that produces “ugly divisions” internally. https://t.co/yW3ObgrLxE

First debate check: we are spinning into climate catastrophe corrupted by dark money and have a captured Supreme Court that specializes in 5-4 partisan decisions. Mentions?  Climate: 19 (tolerable)                 Dark money: 2 (lame) Supreme Court: 1 (in passing)

Wish I could be there to join @NKdems for tonight's tribute to Democratic National Committeewoman Edna O'Neill Mattson. Edna is a RI legend whose decades of service to the Party have made our state a better place.
Republicans are in court trying to take away preexisting condition coverage all of ACA so let’s not get into circular firing squad. Time and common sense will be our friends on way to MFA.
We need an answer for labor h&w plans protections fought for in state Medicaid programs and TriCare.

I like #MedicareforAll and have cosponsored but never understood why Medicare Advantage shouldn’t be a part of it — lots of people like it. We nearly got my public option into #ACA; another good idea. https://t.co/F9JmmpcwG3
Every time I’ve asked Elizabeth has been there: from our report on #ChamberofCarbon to calling out Web of Denial to taking the lead on one of our “crash warnings” weeklies. https://t.co/tIx3BMHroq

Oh great. Celebrity journalists get airtime/clicks to ask asinine questions as candidates swing for the fences and Democrats generally look ridiculous. Trump must love our “debates.” https://t.co/UTspTCDasn

Typical. @APIEnergy and Western Energy Alliance are fossil fuel front groups who have no plan to deal with carbon pollution and climate change (other than doing more of the former and denying the latter). But they complain about other plans. Pathetic. https://t.co/21zyvNAsA6

I throw in #ChamberofCarbon because @USChamber (a) hides its big funders and (b) has been identified in a virtual tie for worst climate obstructor in America. When you’re beating @APIEnergy on climate obstruction that’s really saying something!

Actually you could combine this debate with a climate change debate; since corrupting dark-money influence and rampant climate obstruction/denial are two sides of the same oily fossil-fuel-funded coin. Hello #ChamberofCarbon.  https://t.co/yqAnPjnlhv

Steyer getting in is another boost for climate. He adds a climate voice that has been stronger longer than most candidates. Inslee and Warren can stand with him but Inslee hasn’t caught traction and Warren is good on so many issues. Steyer entry imo is a plus for climate. https://t.co/MCvpv2Ojla
A dark-money group wants candidates to release lists? How about YOU release who’s funding this? Who are you fronting for @judicialnetwork? https://t.co/TKjNaHer8c
Exciting news here and a video you will be glad you watched. https://t.co/NPkGIxM9Fk
I’ve seen better opening days . . . . https://t.co/nBNLFgWnRs

2. Will you investigate the flow of dark money into politics & see how much dark money can be traced back to fossil fuel interests? If necessary would you ask the AG to convene a grand jury to understand dark money flow & look for crimes facilitated by fossil fuel dark money?

1. Will you ask your AG to conduct an investigation to see if DOJ’s successful lawsuit against the tobacco industry for fraudulent denial of its product’s dangers is a model for a similar DOJ lawsuit against the fossil fuel industry for fraudulent denial of its product’s dangers?
Here are two salient questions: https://t.co/5AnjEdu6IK
And in the meantime this nonsense may cost us the Senate.

How many more overcrowded and unhelpful debates do we need before we just hand the keys over to Trump?  Fun for the political gossip press; great for candidates no one has ever heard of; cool for laying out punch lines; useless at advancing defeat of Trump. https://t.co/jZDZLK5qmT

“Here's how Republicans can win the climate change debate in 2020”? Here’s why they likely won’t: they have become so dependent on fossil fuel political money. Fossil fuel interests don’t yet sincerely support any price on carbon. Republicans can’t cross their captors. https://t.co/VZ84e4voMm

“Climate change got just 15 minutes out of 4 hours of Democratic debates.” Yes but look how much time preening prancing and self-congratulation got! And then there were the candidates . . . . https://t.co/UmEuBGK0I7

I love this. A campaign takes good climate text from good expert groups in a good climate plan and gets a ration of hassle about it from — the climate deniers at Fox News. Could they be less self-aware? https://t.co/1YFQ00qi0G
Count me unconcerned if a campaign’s cutting and pasting from good environmental groups’ websites in tackling climate policy.   https://t.co/X9zIzUqWGE

“…But captured by Big Oil and its money Washington continues to deny the threat and stand in the way of meaningful action to address it.” Add @USChamber and @ShopFloorNAM climate mischief to the story.
I’m supporting @ewarren’s bill: “Time and time again senior military leaders have warned Congress of the national security challenge that climate change poses. ...” https://t.co/E4IaYyuXOw
Whatever Inslee’s political prospects are his message is important & his commitment on climate is well established. https://t.co/G8pahRuqVs
Wouldn’t it be wise to win first? Then we can have a robust debate based on facts and science. Give Trump a second term and lies and money will control.    https://t.co/7haEVTCL9p
We can end the U.S. Chamber’s coal-stained grip on Congress by joining together to support the right candidates and taking on the fossil fuel lobby’s outsized and undue influence. #ChamberOfCarbon

.@USChamber has spent decades fighting climate action: filing federal lawsuits propping up climate deniers in Congress and spending $1.5 billion to influence environmental policy and kill climate legislation. #ChamberOfCarbon

When Trump calls us socialists remember the last time this rhetoric was used when Republicans tried to stop Medicare by calling it “socialized medicine.” If you like Medicare beware what this rhetoric conceals.   https://t.co/yranWDcKXz

About time! Now we just need to get Republicans off their butts. Which means exposing the continuing political mischief of the fossil fuel industry & all its front groups (like @USChamber). https://t.co/r4EYLBrd3W
#HappyEaster! I hope all those celebrating have a great day spent with friends & family.
It is imperative that Congress conduct public hearings on Mueller’s findings to provide the American people with the answers they deserve.
Russia conducted an unprecedented influence campaign on our 2016 elections and – at best – Donald Trump repeatedly cast doubt on and spread conspiracy theories about the ensuing investigation.
Wishing a happy #Passover to the Rhode Islanders & everyone celebrating tonight!
It’s nice at last to see climate become a priority. It barely came up in last election debates. https://t.co/QX5aWXla2s
I urge the attorney general to fulfill his duty and make Mueller’s report public. Nothing short of that offers the possibility of an acceptable resolution to this mess.
Congrats to RI’s newest state rep.-elect @junespeakman. https://t.co/drTgKAdpg9

Using this calm before the storm to knock on doors in Bristol with my friend @JuneSpeakman. We’ve got a special election coming up on Tuesday 3/5 in Bristol and Warren and I know June has the experience to get things done at the State House. https://t.co/cPlAB8KNhJ
Climate steps up as an issue from a governor who was all about it before it was cool. https://t.co/hurg1JiKaZ
